body: @correctmost any particular reason you added this warning and want curl to build warning-free with it?

> [@correctmost](https://github.com/correctmost) any particular reason you added this warning and want curl to build warning-free with it?

I build curl with `-Weverything` (and a few exclusions) to help detect potential regressions in my local environment.  This warning got triggered when I upgraded Clang from v20 to v21.

I thought I'd report the new warning in case it helps with correctness.  If fixing it makes the code worse, then it might be best to just close the issue.

Thanks for taking a look!

`openldap.c` is the only place this bites. All other places with similar callback structs use the declaration function style that @vszakats pointed out. In that sense, `openldap.c`deviates from the coding style we use in all other places of curl.

If indeed, this is the only place, I propose to adapt @vszakats patch.

> If indeed, this is the only place, I propose to adapt @vszakats patch.

I agree

I'm surprised `-Weverything` did not catch other things. In my test it lists
6122 warnings in lib and src, and 97286 warnings when building `testdeps`.
That's only with a single build combination, with more expected with other
platforms, TLS backends, etc.

Why is this specific warning special compared to the rest?

> 6122 warnings in lib and src

ðŸ˜²

Here's a breakdown by type (these exclude warnings specifically silenced with picky warnings enabled):
```
2605 -Wunsafe-buffer-usage
1850 -Wused-but-marked-unused
 815 -Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast
 225 -Wpadded
 203 -Wreserved-identifier
 129 -Wformat
  95 -Wswitch-enum
  90 -Wswitch-default
  77 -Wdisabled-macro-expansion
  13 -Wcovered-switch-default
   6 -Wcast-function-type-strict
   5 -Wc++-keyword
   4 -Wc++-hidden-decl
   2 -Wreserved-macro-identifier
   2 -Wdocumentation-unknown-command
   1 -Wtentative-definition-compat
```

testdeps:
```
86894 -Wused-but-marked-unused
4641 -Wunsafe-buffer-usage
2611 -Wdisabled-macro-expansion
 945 -Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast
 866 -Wformat
 710 -Wreserved-identifier
 363 -Wpadded
 107 -Wswitch-enum
  98 -Wswitch-default
  13 -Wcovered-switch-default
   8 -Wformat-non-iso
   8 -Wc++-hidden-decl
   7 -Wdocumentation-unknown-command
   6 -Wcast-function-type-strict
   5 -Wc++-keyword
   2 -Wreserved-macro-identifier
   1 -Wtentative-definition-compat
   1 -Wconditional-uninitialized
```

total 101816:
```
87896 -Wused-but-marked-unused
6783 -Wunsafe-buffer-usage
2639 -Wdisabled-macro-expansion
1717 -Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast
 985 -Wformat
 812 -Wreserved-identifier
 543 -Wpadded
 188 -Wswitch-enum
 177 -Wswitch-default
  23 -Wcovered-switch-default
  12 -Wcast-function-type-strict
  12 -Wc++-hidden-decl
   8 -Wformat-non-iso
   8 -Wdocumentation-unknown-command
   8 -Wc++-keyword
   2 -Wtentative-definition-compat
   2 -Wreserved-macro-identifier
   1 -Wconditional-uninitialized
```

> Why is this specific warning special compared to the rest?

I filed the issue for `-Wtentative-definition-compat` because the warning is new in v21 and because it might highlight a latent issue in the codebase.

Of the ~100 FOSS projects that I regularly compile with `-Weverything`, I only saw the `-Wtentative-definition-compat` warning in a few like Cairo and libmtp.  This made me think the warning had more signal than some of the other new warnings like `-Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast` and `-Wc++-keyword` (I think the `-Wc` entries in your lists are truncated).

Another new warning introduced by clang 21 is `-Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast`, with 1717 hits.

Example:
```
lib/altsvc.c:89:18: warning: implicit conversion when initializing 'struct altsvc *' with an expression of type 'void *' is not permitted in C++ [-Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast]
   89 |   struct altsvc *as = calloc(1, sizeof(struct altsvc));
      |                  ^    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```
The fact that something is not permitted in C++ seems like a weird reason to warn for C code...
Adding typecasts for these lines adds nothing but clutter. I think we should not use this flag.

Agree on `-Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast`. It's steady noise and no benefit.

It feels odd to apply this C++ rule to C, even with `-Weverything`. I'm
curious what lead to this.

issue.title: build: address some `-Weverything` warnings, update picky warnings

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
`-Weverything` is not enabled by curl, and not recommended by LLVM,
because it may enable experimental options, and will result in new
fallouts after toolchain upgrades. This patch aims to fix/silence as much
as possible as found with llvm/clang 21.1.0. It also permanently enables
warnings that were fixed in source and deemed manageable in the future.
`-Wformat` warnings are addressed separately via #18343.

Fix/silence warnings in the source:
- typecheck-gcc.h: fix `-Wreserved-identifier`.
- lib: silence `-Wcast-function-type-strict`.
  For llvm 16+ or Apple clang 16+.
- asyn-ares: limit `HAPPY_EYEBALLS_DNS_TIMEOUT` to old c-ares versions.
- curl_trc: fix `-Wc++-hidden-decl`.
- doh: fix `-Wc++-keyword`.
- ftp: fix `-Wreserved-identifier`.
- ldap: fix `-Wreserved-identifier`.
- mqtt: comment unused macro to avoid warning.
- multi_ev: drop unused macros to avoid warnings.
- setopt: fix useless `break;` after `return;`.
- gtls, mbedtls, rustls: silence `-Wconditional-uninitialized`.
- socks_sspi, schannel, x509asn1: fix `-Wimplicit-int-enum-cast`.
- x509asn1: fix `-Wc++-keyword`.
- openssl: scope `OSSL_UI_METHOD_CAST` to avoid unused macro warning.
- libssh2, wolfssl: drop unused macros.
- curl_ngtcp2, curl_quiche, httpsrr, urlapi: drop/limit unused macros.
- tool_getparam: fix useless `break;` after `return;` or `break;`.
  Not normally enabled because it doesn't work with unity.
  https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/71046
- tool_operate: fix `-Wc++-keyword`.
- curlinfo: fix a `-Wunsafe-buffer-usage`.
- tests: silence `-Wformat-non-iso`.
- lib557: fix `-Wreserved-identifier`.
- lib1565: silence `-Wconditional-uninitialized`.

Enable the above clang warnings permanently in picky mode:
- `-Wc++-hidden-decl`
- `-Wc++-keyword` (except for Windows, where it collides with `wchar_t`)
- `-Wcast-function-type-strict`
- `-Wcast-function-type`
- `-Wconditional-uninitialized`
- `-Wformat-non-iso` (except for clang-cl)
- `-Wreserved-identifier`
- `-Wtentative-definition-compat`

Silence problematic `-Weverything` warnings globally (in picky mode):
- `-Wused-but-marked-unused` (88000+ hits) and
  `-Wdisabled-macro-expansion` (2600+ hits).
  Triggered by `typecheck-gcc.h` when building with clang 14+.
  Maybe there exists a way to fix within that header?
  Ref: https://discourse.llvm.org/t/removing-wused-but-marked-unused/55310
- `-Wunsafe-buffer-usage`. clang 16+. 7000+ hits.
  May be useful in theory, but such high volume of hits makes it
  impractical to review and possibly address. Meant for C++.
  Ref: https://clang.llvm.org/docs/SafeBuffers.html
  Ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/77017567/how-to-fix-code-to-avoid-warning-wunsafe-buffer-usage
  Ref: https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-c-buffer-hardening/65734
  Ref: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/111624
- `-Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast`. clang 21+. 1700+ hits.
  C++ warning, deemed pure noise.
  Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/18470#issuecomment-3253506266
- `-Wswitch-default` (180+ hits), `-Wswitch-enum` (190+ hits),
  `-Wcovered-switch-default` (20+ hits).
  Next to impossible to fix cleanly, esp. when the covered `case`
  branches depend on compile-time options.
- `-Wdocumentation-unknown-command` (8+ hits).
  Triggered in a few sources. Seems arbitrary and bogus.
- `-Wpadded` (550+ hits).
- `-Wc++-keyword` on Windows, where it collides with `wchar_t`.
  (100+ hits)
  Ref: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/155988
- `-Wreserved-macro-identifier`. clang 13+. 5+ hits.
  Sometimes it's necessary to set external macros that use
  the reserved namespace. E.g. `_CRT_NONSTDC_NO_DEPRECATE`,
  `__ENVIRONMENT_MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED__`, `__NO_NET_API`,
  possibly `_REENTRANT`, and more.
  It's not worth trying to silence them individually.
- `-Wnonportable-system-include-path` with `clang-cl`.
  It'd be broken by doing what the warning suggests.
- `-Wformat-non-iso` for clang-cl.

CMake `PICKY_COMPILER=ON` (the default) or `./configure`
`--enable-warnings` (not the default) is required to enable these
silencing rules.

Also:
- autotools, cmake: fix Apple clang and mainline llvm version translations.
  Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xcode#Toolchain_versions
- autotools, cmake: enable `-Warray-compare` for clang 20+.
  Follow-up to 4b7accda5ae3f2e663aa3f3853805241ef87c2fe #17196
- cmake: fix to enable `-Wmissing-variable-declarations` at an earlier
  clang version.
- cmake: update internal logic to handle warning options with `+` in
  them.
- cmake: fix internal logic to match the whole option when looking
  into `CMAKE_C_FLAGS` for custom-disabled warnings.

Follow-up to b85cb8cb4e143d1615d4fcc1ce8f2f7b66453995 #18485

---

w/o sp https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/18477/files?w=1

- [x] enable warnings that were silenced in-source via this patch
- [x] fixup clang version guard for Apple clang
- [x] apply cmake changes to autotools too
- [x] rebase on #18478
- [x] consider disabling `-Wcast-function-type-strict` globally? â†’ Leaving them there for "awareness". But, there seems to be no way to fix these in most cases, because the callback types are either part of the public curl APIs, or part of public external APIs. In `url.c` it may be possible to wrap fwrite/fread in internal functions to match the signature exactly, but it's even more noise (and runtime perf hit) with no benefit for current code.

body:
llvm links for `-Wimplicit-void-ptr-cast` added to `-Weverything`:
https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=17418
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/17792
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/136855
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/15321d2c9e686b382262339fa17c5445b1b2609f

It's a fix for an old bug report (2013).

> The fact that something is not permitted in C++ seems like a weird reason to warn for C code...

I guess the idea probably is that some environments (like VS by default and always in older versions) compile C code as C++.

> > The fact that something is not permitted in C++ seems like a weird reason to warn for C code...
> 
> I guess the idea probably is that some environments (like VS by default and always in older versions) compile C code as C++.

According to the docs, .c files are compiled as C by default:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/reference/tc-tp-tc-tp-specify-source-file-type

Can't recall MSVC enforcing this particular requirement with
any tested version. (unless explicitly passing `-TP` to select
C++ mode)

issue.title: openldap: fix `-Wtentative-definition-compat`

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
It's a `-Weverything` warning that appeared in llvm/clang 21.

```
lib/openldap.c:1297:19: warning: duplicate declaration of 'ldapsb_tls' is invalid in C++ [-Wtentative-definition-compat]
 1297 | static Sockbuf_IO ldapsb_tls =
      |                   ^
lib/openldap.c:499:19: note: previous declaration is here
  499 | static Sockbuf_IO ldapsb_tls;
      |                   ^
```

Reported-by: correctmost on github
Fixes #18470
Cherry-picked from #18477
